text.48_Chapter, 32_Verse, 0_Comment: He gathered up his feet. He had been sitting until this point. Hashem granted him power over his limbs until the moment of his death.
text.46_Chapter, 20_Verse, 0_Comment: He then transferred the people. In order that no one would claim a right to his former land.
text.38_Chapter, 9_Verse, 0_Comment: To be with her. He was careful never to be alone with her until the day that it occurred against his will.
text.41_Chapter, 11_Verse, 0_Comment: He said to them, “No.” He argued that real brothers would have left someone behind to tend their father, to which they replied that there were actually twelve of them. In this way Yoseif learned that Binyamin was still alive.
text.39_Chapter, 13_Verse, 0_Comment: But remember me. Yoseif said this to him to underscore his certainty that the butler would be restored to Pharaoh’s good graces. And here I have also done nothing. I know you will be able to free me, since in any event I am innocent.
text.31_Chapter, 24_Verse, 1_Comment: A man wrestled with him. Yaakov had intended on hurrying across in order to flee before Eisov arrived, but Hashem sent the angel to detain him so that he would see the fulfillment of His promise to protect him.
text.26_Chapter, 45_Verse, 0_Comment: If Yaakov marries. This was a stratagem to distance Yaakov from Eisov without revealing to Yitzchok the reason for it.
text.41_Chapter, 7_Verse, 0_Comment: But they did not recognize him. They did not recognize his voice because he spoke through an interpreter.
text.34_Chapter, 16_Verse, 0_Comment: For this one will also be a son. Just as you requested (30:24). For you. Surely this is a sign that you are not meant to die — the midwife said this to encourage her.
text.29_Chapter, 24_Verse, 0_Comment: Send me on my way. Simultaneous with Yosef’s birth Yaakov completed his second set of seven years of labor.
text.25_Chapter, 27_Verse, 0_Comment: Let there now be an oath. Let the oath that we made with Avraham also apply to you, since in any event it was stipulated that it would also apply to my son and grandson (21:23).
text.36_Chapter, 31_Verse, 0_Comment: They sent. They hired strangers to bring it to him with instructions to say that they found it themselves.
text.23_Chapter, 34_Verse, 0_Comment: Ad-noy blessed my master greatly. People from all over the world have tried to conclude a match with him, but he has refused them all.
text.27_Chapter, 5_Verse, 0_Comment: Eisov saw. He saw that Yitzchok conferred Avraham’s blessing upon Yaakov, including inheritance of the land, while at the same time instructing him to take a wife from Avraham’s family. Therefore Eisov hoped that by marrying Avraham’s granddaughter he might regain a portion of the land.
text.46_Chapter, 3_Verse, 0_Comment: Since there is no pasture. They were not short of money, only pasture; therefore Pharaoh should not think they had come to live off of Yoseif’s largess.
text.26_Chapter, 29_Verse, 0_Comment: And Yaakov had just left. This was another miracle because if Eisov had arrived a moment earlier, Yaakov would not have received the blessings.
text.23_Chapter, 63_Verse, 0_Comment: She let herself down. Until then she had been riding on Eliezer’s camel because she had been afraid to ride alone. Now she distanced herself from him out of modesty.
text.31_Chapter, 6_Verse, 0_Comment: We came to your brother. You have indeed found favor in his eyes and he is coming to meet you with joy and love, accompanied by an honor guard of four hundred men.
text.24_Chapter, 30_Verse, 0_Comment: As of this day. That is, immediately. Sell your birthright. Sell your double portion in our father’s estate in exchange for the cash that I will pay you now and afterwards I will serve you food in commemoration of the agreement.
text.45_Chapter, 7_Verse, 0_Comment: Yaakov and his sons. Yaakov himself is included in the reckoning of the seventy souls.
text.27_Chapter, 10_Verse, 1_Comment: Because the sun had set. He was unable to reach the next town before sunset.
